page.title: 16Darlington Cattle Market
page.content: {The cattle market}is on Clifton Road where it has been since 1893. On our visit the first thing we did was to see the cattle being unloaded. Then we talked to the animal health inspector from the{RSPCA.} He was there to see that the animals were well looked after. Some vets came to test the young calves to see if they would grow up good and healthy or not. The camera team from{"Look North", {the BBC TV news programme,}was filming the vets testing the calves. I asked {Allan Powell,}the news-reporter, whether he thought the cattle-market should be moved to the outskirts of town and he, like some of the farmers we asked, thought it should stay where it is. Others, like the{RSPCA man,} would like it to be in the country.{ {S. Holmes & J. Sadler.
